entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: From midnight, snow is expected to lower to 500 metres. 10 to 15 cm may accumulate about the tunnel Saturday morning with lesser amounts lower down. Snow showers may continue Saturday afternoon but little if any snow is expected to settle.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
A very fast moving front passes northwards through central and northern New Zealand late morning and during the afternoon, bringing a burst of heavy rain and strong winds, along with a moderate risk of squally thunderstorms with wind gusts up to 110 km/h.
Additionally, there is a moderate risk that these thunderstorms could become severe, generating wind gusts in excess of 110 km/h. Wind gusts of this strength can cause some structural damage, including trees and power lines, and may make driving hazardous.
Thunderstorms have eased in Grey and Buller Districts and the Watch has been lifted for these areas.
Stay up to date with forecasts in case changes are made.

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale westerlies gusting 120km/h in exposed places. Note: Another burst of strong winds is possible early Sunday morning. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.
